name: Age-standardized prevalence of insufficiently physically active persons aged 18+ years

property.abbreviated_name: Insufficient physical activity in adults (Also: adolescents)
property.definition: Age-standardized prevalence of insufficiently physically active persons aged 18+ years (percentage of adults aged 18+ years not meeting any of the following criteria: 150 minutes of moderate-intensity physical activity per week; 75 minutes of vigorous-intensity physical activity per week; an equivalent combination of moderate- and vigorous-intensity physical activity accumulating at least 600 metabolic equivalent minutes per week (minutes of physical activity can be accumulated over the course of a week but must be of a duration of at least 10 minutes).*Metabolic equivalent (MET) is the ratio of a person’s working metabolic rate relative to the resting metabolic rate. One metabolic equivalent is defined as the energy cost of sitting quietly and is equivalent to a caloric consumption of 1 kcal/kg per hour. Physical activities are frequently classified by their intensity, using the metabolic equivalent as a reference.
property.numerator: Number of respondents where all three of the following criteria are true: weekly minutes* of vigorous activity < 75 minutes; weekly minutes* of moderate activity < 150 minutes;weekly metabolic equivalent minutes** < 600. * Weekly minutes are calculated by multiplying the number of days on which vigorous/moderate activity is done by the number of minutes of vigorous/moderate activity per day.** Weekly metabolic equivalent minutes are calculated by multiplying the weekly minutes of vigorous activity by 8 and the number of weekly minutes of moderate activity by 4 and then adding these two results together.
property.denominator: All respondents of the survey aged 18+ years.
property.disaggregation: Age, sex, other relevant sociodemographic stratifiers where availableAlso: Prevalence of insufficiently physically active adolescents (defined as less than 60 minutes of moderate to vigorous intensity activity daily)
property.measurement_method: (Number of respondents aged 18+ years not meeting the aforementioned criteria for physical activity)/(number of survey respondents aged 18+ years) x 100.
property.estimation_method: At least every 5 years
property.preferred_data_sources: Draft comprehensive global monitoring framework and targets for the prevention and control of noncommunicable diseases, including a set of indicators. Agenda item A66/8, Sixty-sixth World Health Assembly, 20-28 May 2013. Geneva: World Health Organization; 2013 (http://apps.who.int/gb/ebwha/pdf_files/WHA66/A66_8-en.pdf?ua=1, accessed 29 March 2015).

name: Intimate partner violence prevalence

property.definition: Percentage of currently partnered girls and women aged 15?49 years who have experienced physical and/or sexual violence by their current intimate partner in the last 12 months.
property.numerator: Number of girls and women who currently have an intimate partner, and who report experiencing physical or sexual violence by their current intimate partner in the past 12 months.

property.disaggregation: Age (15?19, 20?24 and 25?49 years), HIV status

property.estimation_method: 5 years

Geneva: Joint United Nations Programme on HIV/AIDS; 2014 (http://www.unaids.org/en/media/unaids/contentassets/documents/document/2014/GARPR_2014_guidelines_en.pdf, accessed 29 March 2015).

name: Demand for family planning satisfied with modern methods

property.abbreviated_name: Demand for family planning satisfied with modern methods
property.subdomain: Reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent health
property.terms: Reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent
property.definition: Percentage of women of reproductive age (15?49 years) who are sexually active and who have their need for family planning satisfied with modern methods.
property.numerator: Number of women with family planning demand who use modern methods
property.denominator: Total number of women in need of family planning.
property.disaggregation: Age, marital status, place of residence, socioeconomic status
property.measurement_method: Household surveys include a series of questions to measure modern contraceptive prevalence rate and demand for family planning. Total demand for family planning is defined as the sum of the number of women of reproductive age (15-49 years) who are married or in a union and who are currently using, or whose sexual partner is currently using, at least one contraceptive method, and the unmet need for family planning. Unmet need for family planning is the proportion of women of reproductive age (15-49 years) either married or in a consensual union, who are fecund and sexually active but who are not using any method of contraception (modern or traditional), and report not wanting any more children or wanting to delay the birth of their next child for at least two years. Included are: 1.  all pregnant women (married or in a consensual union) whose pregnancies were unwanted or mistimed at the time of conception; 2.  all postpartum amenorrhoeic women (married or in consensual union) who are not using family planning and whose last birth was unwanted or mistimed; 3.  all fecund women (married or in consensual union) who are neither pregnant nor postpartum amenorrhoeic, and who either do not want any more children (want to limit family size), or who wish to postpone the birth of a child for at least two years or do not know when or if they want another child (want to space births), but are not using any contraceptive method.
property.estimation_method: Every 3?5 years
property.preferred_data_sources: Countdown to 2015. Monitoring maternal, newborn and child health: understanding key progress indicators. Geneva: World Health Organization; 2011 (http://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/10665/44770/1/9789241502818_eng.pdf, accessed 29 March 2015).

name: Contraceptive prevalence rate

property.subdomain: Reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent health
property.terms: Reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent
property.definition: Percentage of women aged 15?49 years, married or in union, who are currently using, or whose sexual partner is using, at least one method of contraception, regardless of the method used.
property.numerator: Number of women using or partner using a contraceptive method.
property.denominator: Number of women married or in a union.
property.disaggregation: Age, method (short, long, permanent), place of residence, sexually active (irrespective of marital status or whether in a union), socioeconomic status
property.measurement_method: Contraceptive prevalence = (women of reproductive age [15?49 years] who are married or in a union and who are currently using any method of contraception)/(total number of women of reproductive age [15?49 years] who are married or in a union) x 100.Household surveys that can generate this indicator include DHS, MICS, Fertility and Family Surveys (FFS), Reproductive Health Surveys (RHS) and other surveys based on similar methodologies.
property.estimation_method: The United Nations Population Division compiles data from nationally representative surveys, including the DHS, MICS, FFS, the CDC-assisted RHS and national family planning, or health, or household, or socioeconomic surveys. In general, all nationally representative surveys with comparable questions on current use of contraception are included. There is no attempt to provide estimates when country data are not available. The results are published regularly in the World Contraceptive Use report.Predominant type of statistics: adjusted.
property.preferred_data_sources: Household surveys
property.other_data_sources: Routine facility information systems/health facility assessments and surveys

name: Antenatal care coverage ? at least four visits (%)

property.subdomain: Reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent health
property.terms: Reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent
property.definition: Percentage of women aged 15?49 years with a live birth in a given time period who received antenatal care, four times or more.
property.numerator: Number of women aged 15?49 years with a live birth in a given time period who received antenatal care four or more times.
property.denominator: Total number of women aged 15?49 years with a live birth in the same period.
property.disaggregation: Age, place of residence, socioeconomic status, type of providerAlso: at least one visit
property.measurement_method: The number of women aged 15?49 years with a live birth in a given time period who received antenatal care four or more times during pregnancy is expressed as a percentage of women aged 15?49 with a live birth in the same period. (Number of women aged 15?49 years attended at least four times during pregnancy by any provider for reasons related to the pregnancy/total number of women aged 15?49 years with a live birth) x 100.The indicators of antenatal care (at least one visit and at least four visits) are based on standard questions that ask if and how many times the health of the woman was checked during pregnancy. This is because the key national-level household surveys do not collect information on type of provider for each visit. The indicators of antenatal care (at least one visit and at least four visits) are based on standard questions that ask if, how many times, and by whom the health of the woman was checked during pregnancy. Household surveys that can generate this indicator include DHS, MICS, FFS, RHS and other surveys based on similar methodologies. Service/facility reporting systems can be used where the coverage is high, usually in industrialized countries.
property.estimation_method: Annual from routine facility reports; every 3?5 years from survey
property.preferred_data_sources: Routine facility information systems
property.other_data_sources: Countdown to 2015 decade report (2000?2010): taking stock of maternal, newborn and child survival. name: Births attended by skilled health personnel (%)

property.abbreviated_name: Births attended by skilled health personnel
property.subdomain: Reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent health
property.terms: Reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent
property.definition: Percentage of live births attended by skilled health personnel during a specified time period.
property.numerator: Number of births attended by skilled health personnel (doctors, nurses or midwives) trained in providing life-saving obstetric care, including giving the necessary supervision, care and advice to women during pregnancy, childbirth and the postpartum period, to conduct deliveries on their own, and to care for newborns.
property.denominator: The total number of live births in the same period.
property.disaggregation: Age, parity, place of residence, socioeconomic status, type of providerAlso: Institutional delivery coverage (women giving birth in a health institution) among all births in the population
property.measurement_method: Definition of skilled birth attendant varies between countries. The percentage of births attended by skilled health personnel is calculated as the number of births attended by skilled health personnel (doctors, nurses or midwives) expressed as a percentage of the total number of births in the same period. Births attended by skilled health personnel = (number of births attended by skilled health personnel)/(total number of live births) x 100.In household surveys, such as DHS, MICS and RHS, the respondent is asked about each live birth and who helped during delivery for a period up to five years before the interview. Service/facility records could be used where a high proportion of births occur in health facilities and are therefore recorded.
property.estimation_method: Data for global monitoring are reported by UNICEF and WHO. These agencies obtain the data ? both survey and registry data - from national sources. Before data can be included in the global databases, UNICEF and WHO undertake a process of data verification that includes correspondence with field offices to clarify any questions.In terms of survey data, some survey reports may present a total percentage of births attended by a type of provider that does not conform to the MDG definition (e.g. total includes providers who are not considered skilled, such as community health workers). In this case, the percentage delivered by a physician, nurse or midwife are totalled and entered into the global database as the MDG estimate. Predominant type of statistics: adjusted.
property.preferred_data_sources: Household surveys
property.other_data_sources: Routine facility information systems

name: Percentage of children under 5 years of age with suspected pneumonia taken to a health facility

property.subdomain: Reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent health
property.terms: Reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent
property.definition: Percentage of children under 5 years of age with suspected pneumonia (cough and difficult breathing NOT due to a problem in the chest and a blocked nose) in the two weeks preceding the survey taken to an appropriate health facility or provider.
property.numerator: Number of children with suspected pneumonia in the two weeks preceding the survey taken to an appropriate health provider.
property.denominator: Number of children with suspected pneumonia in the two weeks preceding the survey.
property.disaggregation: Place of residence, provider, sex, socioeconomic status, Also: with “receiving appropriate antibiotics”
property.measurement_method: During the UNICEF/WHO Meeting on Child Survival Survey-based Indicators, held in New York, USA, on 17-18 June 2004, it was recommended that suspected Acute Respiratory Infection (ARI) be described as “presumed pneumonia” to better reflect the probable cause and the recommended interventions. The definition of ARI used in the DHS and MICS was chosen by the group and is based on the mother’s perceptions of a child who has a cough, is breathing faster than usual with short, quick breaths or is having difficulty breathing, excluding children who had only a blocked nose.
property.estimation_method: Every 3?5 years
property.preferred_data_sources: Countdown to 2015. Monitoring maternal, newborn and child health: understanding key progress indicators. Geneva: World Health Organization; 2011 (http://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/10665/44770/1/9789241502818_eng.pdf, accessed 29 March 2015).

name: Immunization coverage rate by vaccine for each vaccine in the national schedule

property.abbreviated_name: Immunization coverage rate by vaccine for each vaccine in the national schedule
property.subdomain: Reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent health
property.definition: Percentage of the target population that has received the last recommended dose for each vaccine recommended in the national schedule by vaccine. This should include all vaccines within a country’s routine immunization schedule (e.g., Bacillus Calmette-Guérin (BCG); polio; pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (PCV); rotavirus; diphtheria, tetanus, pertussis-Hepatitis B-Haemophilus influenzae type B vaccine (DTP-HepB-Hib); measles (MCV); rubella; human papilloma virus (HPV); tetanus toxoid (TT); influenza; and others as determined by the national schedule).
property.numerator: The number of individuals in the target group for each vaccine that has received the last recommended dose in the series. For vaccines in the infant immunization schedule, this would be the number of children aged 12-23 months who have received the specified vaccinations before their first birthday.
property.denominator: The total number of individuals in the target group for each vaccine. For vaccines in the infant immunization schedule, this would be the total number of infants surviving to age one.
property.disaggregation: Age, place of residence, sex, socioeconomic statusDTP1-DTP3 dropout rate, MCV1-MCV2 dropout, full immunization coverage where possible
property.measurement_method: Example of a national schedule is:At birth: BCG, HepB, oral polio vaccine At 6, 10 and 14 weeks: DTP-HepB-Hib, PCV, rotavirus, oral polio vaccine (with one dose of inactivated polio vaccine)At 9 months: measlesAt 18 months measlesFor adolescents: HPVTT: multipleFor persons aged over 60 years: influenza.
property.estimation_method: For survey data, the vaccination status of children aged 12-23 months is used for vaccines included in the infant immunization schedule, collected from child health cards or, if there is no card, from recall by the care-taker.
property.measurement_frequency: Annual tracking through facility information systems, supplemented by periodic estimation through household surveys
property.preferred_data_sources: Household surveys, facility information systems
property.other_data_sources: Countdown to 2015. Monitoring maternal, newborn and child health: understanding key progress indicators. Geneva: World Health Organization; 2011 (http://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/10665/44770/1/9789241502818_eng.pdf, accessed 29 March 2015).

name: People living with HIV who have been diagnosed (%)

property.abbreviated_name: People living with HIV who have been diagnosed
property.definition: Percentage of people living with HIV who have been diagnosed.
property.numerator: Number of people living with HIV who have been diagnosed.
property.denominator: Estimated number of people living with HIV.
property.disaggregation: Age (<1, 1-4, 5-9, 10-19, 20-24, 25-49, 50+ years), sex, key populations, other target populations
property.measurement_method: The denominator is the estimated total number of people living with HIV based on HIV estimation models, such as Spectrum. If an HIV case report registry that is regularly updated is available, the numerator can be calculated by taking the number of cases reported in the registry and subtracting any deaths that may have occurred. Case report data can provide cumulative information on the overall number of people living with HIV who have been diagnosed since the beginning of record-keeping. Household surveys with HIV testing and questions to assess whether respondents know their positive status is another means of measurement.
property.estimation_method: If death records are not widely available for counting the number of people living with HIV who know their HIV status and are alive, other proxy data could be reviewed in order to estimate the indicator value. For example, the number of HIV-related deaths may be estimated from other sources (e.g. cause-specific death registries, modelling). Survey data on the percentage of people living with HIV who know their HIV status (ever, and in the past 12 months) can also be used to triangulate estimates.
property.preferred_data_sources: Surveys and models for estimates
property.other_data_sources: Framework of actions for the follow-up to the Programme of Action of the International Conference on Population and Development beyond 2014. name: HIV care coverage

property.definition: Number and percentage of people living with HIV who are receiving HIV care, as proxied by receipt of at least one of the following during the reporting period: clinical assessment (WHO staging) or CD4 count or viral load or on ART.
property.numerator: Number of HIV-positive adults and children who received HIV care (as proxied by receipt of at least one of the following during the reporting period: clinical assessment (WHO staging) or CD4 count or viral load).
property.denominator: Estimated number of people living with HIV.
property.disaggregation: Age (< 5, 5?14, 15?19, 20?49, 50+ years), key populations*, treatment status (i.e. pre-ART or ART), pregnancy status, sex* In many settings data on key populations cannot be collected from routine programme monitoring and require surveys.
property.measurement_method: General populations: for the numerator, national programme records aggregated from programme monitoring tools, such as patient registers and summary reporting forms; for the denominator, estimation models such as Spectrum. Key populations: surveys.
property.estimation_method: Annual, or more frequently depending on frequency of data use at various levels
property.me_framework: Consolidated Strategic Information Guidelines for HIV in the Health Sector. Geneva: World Health Organization; 2015 (http://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/10665/164716/1/9789241508759_eng.pdf?ua=1, accessed 10 June 2015).

name: Antiretroviral therapy (ART) coverage (%)

property.definition: Percentage of people living with HIV currently receiving ART among the estimated number of adults and children living with HIV.
property.numerator: Number of adults and children who are currently receiving ART at the end of the reporting period.
property.denominator: Estimated number of adults and children living with HIV.
property.disaggregation: Age: 1. Minimum for paper-based (routine): <15, 15+; 2. Annual data extraction of disaggregated data if not reported routinely: <5, 5-9, 10-14, 15-19, 20-24, 25-49, 50+; 3. Electronic system: 5-year age groupsKey populations*, provider type (public/private), regimen type (e.g. first line, second line), sex* In many settings data on key populations cannot be collected from routine programme monitoring and require surveys.
property.measurement_method: Numerator: The numerator can be generated by counting the number of adults and children who received antiretroviral combination therapy at the end of the reporting period. Data can be collected from facility-based ART registers or drug supply management systems. These are then tallied and transferred to cross-sectional monthly or quarterly reports which can then be aggregated for national totals. Patients receiving ART in the private sector and public sector should be included in the numerator where data are available.Denominator: The denominator is generated by estimating the number of people with advanced HIV infection requiring (in need of/eligible for) ART. This estimation must take into consideration a variety of factors, including, but not limited to, the current number of people with HIV, the current number of patients on ART and the natural history of HIV from infection to enrolment on ART. A standard modelling HIV estimation method, such as in the Spectrum model, is recommended.
property.estimation_method: Annual
property.preferred_data_sources: Consolidated Strategic Information Guidelines for HIV in the Health Sector. Geneva: World Health Organization; 2015 (http://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/10665/164716/1/9789241508759_eng.pdf?ua=1, accessed 10 June 2015).

name: HIV viral load suppression

property.definition: Percentage of people on ART who are virologically suppressed (VL level ? 1000 copies/mL).
property.numerator: Number of adults and children living with HIV and on ART who have a suppressed viral load (< 1000 copies/mL).
property.denominator: Total number of adults on ART in the past 12 months.
property.disaggregation: Age: 1. Minimum for paper-based (routine): <15, 15+; 2. Annual data extraction of disaggregated data if not reported routinely: <5, 5-9, 10-14, 15-19, 20-24, 25-49, 50+; 3. Electronic system: 5-year age groupsSex
property.measurement_method: Viral load data recorded in patient records and reported through facilities. If there are representative surveys collecting viral load data among people living with HIV and those on ART, the survey values can be used. Nationally representative surveys of acquired drug resistance also provide information on viral suppression.** Acquired HIVDR Survey (http://www.who.int/hiv/pub/drugresistance/acquired_drugresistance/en/).
property.estimation_method: If a viral load measure is not available from a sufficiently representative sample of people living with HIV who are on ART, the level of viral load suppression among those on ART but without a viral load measurement in the past 12 months needs to be estimated. Estimates can be derived on the basis of characteristics among those without a viral load measure and their expected viral load suppression.
property.preferred_data_sources: Routine facility information systems
property.other_data_sources: Cross-sectional population-based survey

name: TB preventive therapy for HIV-positive people newly enrolled in HIV care

property.abbreviated_name: TB preventive therapy for HIV-positive people newly enrolled in HIV care
property.definition: Number of patients who are started on treatment for latent TB infection expressed as a percentage of the total number newly enrolled in HIV care in a specified time period.
property.numerator: Total number of people living with HIV newly enrolled in HIV care who are started on treatment for latent TB infection in a specified time period.
property.denominator: Total number of persons newly enrolled in HIV care - i.e. registered in the pre-ART or ART register during the specified time period.
property.disaggregation: Adults (aged ? 15 years) and children (aged 0-4 and 5-14 years), sex
property.measurement_method: TB preventive therapy should be started in all eligible persons, and the date of starting treatment should be recorded on an HIV care/ART card (encounter section). Those who accept treatment and receive at least the first dose should then be recorded in pre-ART and ART registers (INH start month/year column).-Numerator: Count the total number of people living with HIV newly enrolled in HIV care during the reporting period who are started on treatment for latent TB infection - i.e. who are given at least one dose of anti-TB drugs (e.g. isoniazid).-Denominator: Count the total number of people living with HIV newly registered in the pre-ART register plus those registered in the ART register during the reporting period.For accurate planning and drug management, additional information should be collected. A pharmacy-based register may be used to record attendance of clients and collection of drugs. Alternatively, the ART facility may maintain a latent TB infection treatment register in parallel with the ART register. Such a record may facilitate understanding of the number of new and continuing patients on latent TB infection treatment, as well as the treatment completion rate and the frequency and type of adverse events.
property.estimation_method: Annual
property.preferred_data_sources: A guide to monitoring and evaluation for collaborative TB/HIV activities (2015 revision). Geneva: World Health Organization; 2015.
property.other_data_sources: Global AIDS response progress reporting 2014: construction of core indicators for monitoring the 2011 United Nations political declaration on HIV/AIDS. Geneva: Joint United Nations Programme on HIV/AIDS; 2014 (http://www.unaids.org/en/media/unaids/contentassets/documents/document/2014/GARPR_2014_guidelines_en.pdf, accessed 29 March 2015).

name: HIV test results for registered new and relapse TB patients

property.abbreviated_name: HIV test results for registered new and relapse TB patients
property.definition: Number of new and relapse TB patients who had an HIV test result recorded in the TB register, expressed as a percentage of the number registered in a specified time period.
property.numerator: Number of new and relapse TB patients registered during the specified time period who had an HIV test result recorded in the TB register.
property.denominator: Total number of new and relapse TB patients registered in the TB register in the specified time period.
property.disaggregation: Adults (aged ? 15 years) and children (aged 0?4 and 5?14 years), HIV status (positive, negative, unknown), sex
property.measurement_method: TB treatment cards and TB registers at the basic management unit should document the HIV status of TB patients. The history of previous TB treatment should also be documented systematically to identify new and relapse TB patients.-Numerator: Count the total number of new and relapse TB patients registered in a specified time period who had their HIV status documented as positive or negative, including those previously documented to be HIV-positive (e.g. documented evidence of enrolment in HIV care). HIV-negative TB patients are those who had a negative HIV test result at the time of current TB diagnosis.-Denominator: Count the total number of new and relapse TB patients registered during the specified time period. Disaggregation of HIV status is documented using HIV test results. This may include TB patients previously documented to be HIV-positive (documented evidence of enrolment in HIV care), those newly detected positive or those having a negative HIV test result at the time of TB diagnosis. The HIV status of all TB patients should be recorded in TB registers at the basic management unit as soon as possible and preferably at the time of TB diagnosis, along with information on past history of TB treatment. This information should be accessible only to the staff directly responsible for the health care of the individual. Maintaining confidentiality is their prime responsibility.-Numerator: The total number of new and relapse TB patients registered in a specified time period who had their HIV status documented as positive, including those previously documented to be HIV-positive (e.g. documented evidence of enrolment in HIV care). -Denominator: The total number of new and relapse TB patients added to the TB register during the specified time period who had their HIV status documented as positive or negative, including those previously documented to be HIV-positive (e.g. documented evidence of enrolment in HIV care). HIV-negative TB patients include those having a negative test result at the time of TB diagnosis.
property.estimation_method: Annual
property.preferred_data_sources: A guide to monitoring and evaluation for collaborative TB/HIV activities (2015 revision). Geneva: World Health Organization; 2015.

name: HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on antiretroviral therapy (ART) during TB treatment

property.abbreviated_name: HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment
property.definition: Number of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients who received ART during TB treatment, expressed as a percentage of those registered in a specified time period.
property.numerator: Total number of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients started on TB treatment during the specified time period who are already on ART or started on ART during TB treatment.
property.denominator: Total number of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients registered during the specified time period.
property.disaggregation: Adults (aged ? 15 years) and children (aged 0-4 and 5-14 years), sex
property.measurement_method: All HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients detected in a specified time period should be counted for measurement of the proportion receiving ART during TB treatment.-Numerator: Count the total number of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients who were started on TB treatment (as recorded in the TB register) and ART, or who were already on ART (as recorded in the ART register).-Denominator: In countries with national web-based data systems with individual case records routinely updated by health facilities, the total number of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients detected during a specified reporting period can be easily computed. With paper-based systems, the National Tuberculosis Control Programme and National AIDS Control Programme should refer to both the TB and HIV registers to obtain the complete number of patients detected. This can be done by counting the total number of new and relapse TB patients added to the TB register during in a specified time period who had their HIV status documented as positive, including patients previously known to be HIV-positive (e.g. documented evidence of enrolment in HIV care). Cases with undocumented TB treatment history should be counted as new cases.The National Tuberculosis Control Programme and National AIDS Control Programme should ensure that the TB register is updated and that all people living with HIV in pre-ART care or on ART who have a recorded TB diagnosis during the reporting period are also registered. Information in the TB and ART registers at facility level should be reconciled monthly or quarterly, taking into account the possibility of time lags in updating TB information in the ART register and ART information in the TB register. Efforts should be made to update such missing data so that both registers are consistent. Care should be taken to avoid double counting of patients across these registers.
property.estimation_method: Annual
property.preferred_data_sources: A guide to monitoring and evaluation for collaborative TB/HIV activities (2015 revision). Geneva: World Health Organization; 2015.

name: Case detection rate for all forms of tuberculosis

property.definition: Percentage of estimated new and relapse TB cases detected in a given year under the internationally recommended tuberculosis control strategy.The term “case detection”, as used here, means that TB is diagnosed in a patient and is reported within the national surveillance system and then to WHO.The term “rate” is used for historical reasons. The indicator is actually a ratio (expressed as a percentage) and not a rate.
property.numerator: Number of new and relapse cases notified in a given year.
property.denominator: Number of estimated incident cases in the same year.
property.disaggregation: Notification data reported by national TB programmes or national surveillance systems (TB notification rate indicator). For methods used for TB incidence, see methods described for that indicator.
property.measurement_method: The number of new and relapse TB cases diagnosed and treated in national TB control programmes and notified to WHO, divided by WHO's estimate of the number of incident TB cases for the same year, expressed as a percentage. Uncertainty bounds are provided in addition to best estimates. For more information, see Chapter 4 of WHO’s Global tuberculosis report 2014 and the online technical appendix.
property.estimation_method: Annual

property.definition: Percentage of notified TB patients estimated to have MDR-TB who were detected with MDR-TB and enrolled on second-line anti-TB treatment in a specified time period.

name: Coverage of preventive chemotherapy for selected neglected tropical diseases

property.abbreviated_name: Coverage of preventive chemotherapy for selected neglected tropical diseases
property.definition: Proportion of the population living in endemic areas requiring preventive chemotherapy that received treatment for at least one of the selected neglected tropical diseases (schistosomiasis, soil-transmitted helminthiases, lymphatic filariasis , onchocerciasis).
property.numerator: Number of people requiring and receiving preventive chemotherapy for at least one of the selected neglected tropical diseases (schistosomiasis, soil-transmitted helminthiases, lymphatic filariasis , onchocerciasis).
property.denominator: Number of people requiring preventive chemotherapy for at least one of the selected neglected tropical diseases (schistosomiasis, soil-transmitted helminthiases, lymphatic filariasis , onchocerciasis).
property.disaggregation: Age group (pre-school-aged children [1?4 years], school-aged [5?14 years] and adults [? 15 years])Disaggregation by sex and district is optional or depends on which diseases are co-endemic
property.measurement_method: Country reporting systems
property.estimation_method: The number of people requiring/receiving preventive chemotherapy through each disease-specific control or elimination programme is reported by national programme managers from ministries of health to WHO. The number of people requiring preventive chemotherapy for each disease was compared among the different age groups in each country, and the largest population in each age group for any of the diseases was selected as the conservative estimate of the number of people requiring preventive chemotherapy for at least one disease in that particular age group. Finally, the largest populations requiring preventive chemotherapy in each age group were summed, and this total was considered to be a conservative estimate of the number of individuals needing preventive chemotherapy for at least one disease. The same principle was used to estimate the number of people who had received integrated preventive chemotherapy. When subnational data on treatment coverage were available, the analysis was conducted at the subnational level.
property.preferred_data_sources: Administrative reporting systems, in particular the Joint Application Package for donated medicines.
property.other_data_sources: Other sources, including estimation and modelling

name: Obstetric and gynaecological admissions owing to abortion

property.definition: Percentage of admissions for (spontaneous or induced) abortion-related complications to service delivery points providing inpatient obstetric and gynaecological services, among all admissions (except those for planned termination of pregnancy).Abortion is the termination of a pregnancy before the fetus has attained viability - i.e. become capable of independent extra-uterine life. Spontaneous abortion is the spontaneous termination of a pregnancy before the fetus has attained viability - i.e. become capable of independent extra-uterine life - and is often referred to as a miscarriage.

property.measurement_method: A cohort analysis can be used to estimate ART retention at specific points in time after initiation of treatment.

name: Birth registration coverage

property.definition: Percentage of births that are registered within one month of age in a civil registration system.
property.numerator: Number of births registered.
property.disaggregation: Place of residence, sex, socioeconomic status
property.measurement_method: Questions are asked about registration status in household surveys. The numerator of this indicator includes children whose birth certificate was seen by the interviewer or whose mother or care-taker says the birth has been registered. Data are also often presented for other age groups such as infants or children under 5 years of age. Civil registration administrative data are another source of data that could be linked to estimates of the expected number of newborns.
property.estimation_method: Estimates of coverage are taken from two sources: (i) the United Nations Demographic Yearbook and (ii) United Nations statistics and UNICEF.
property.preferred_data_sources: Household surveys
property.other_data_sources: Civil registration and vital statistics systems

note: Monitoring the building blocks of health systems: a handbook of indicators and their measurement strategies. Geneva: World Health Organization; 2010 (http://www.who.int/healthinfo/systems/WHO_MBHSS_2010_full_web.pdf?ua=1, accessed 29 March 2015).

name: Death registration coverage

property.definition: Percentage of deaths that are registered (with age and sex).
property.numerator: Number of deaths registered.
property.disaggregation: Place of residenceAlso: registered with cause (ICD)
property.measurement_method: Questions about presence of a death certificate are asked for all recent deaths (e.g. in the last year).
property.estimation_method: WHO estimates coverage by taking the total number of deaths that have been registered with cause-of-death information in the vital registration system for a country and year and then dividing it by the total estimated deaths for that year for the national population. Administrative data sources could be used to obtain the number of death certificates issued and link those to the estimated number of deaths in a given time period.
property.preferred_data_sources: Civil registration and vital statistics systems
property.other_data_sources: Monitoring the building blocks of health systems: a handbook of indicators and their measurement strategies. Geneva: World Health Organization; 2010 (http://www.who.int/healthinfo/systems/WHO_MBHSS_2010_full_web.pdf?ua=1, accessed 29 March 2015).

name: Completeness of reporting by facilities

property.definition: Percentage of facilities that submit reports within the required deadline.
property.numerator: Number of facilities reporting monthly within a given time period.
property.disaggregation: Facility type, geographic location, managing authority, programme
property.measurement_method: The number of reports received from facilities (usually monthly) is divided by the expected number of reports from facilities. Districts also report on a monthly or quarterly basis to national levels, and the received number of reports can be related to the expected number in order to assess completeness.
property.estimation_method: Annual (monthly)
property.preferred_data_sources: Monitoring the building blocks of health systems: a handbook of indicators and their measurement strategies. Geneva: World Health Organization; 2010 (http://www.who.int/healthinfo/systems/WHO_MBHSS_2010_full_web.pdf?ua=1, accessed 29 March 2015).

property.disaggregation: Financing source institutional unit, disease, main type of care, main type of provider, socioeconomic status, subnational level

property.disaggregation: Financing source institutional unit, disease, main type of care, main type of provider, socioeconomic status, subnational level

property.me_framework: Households consumption survey and National Accounts

name: Externally sourced funding as a percentage of current expenditure on health

property.abbreviated_name: Externally sourced funding (% of current expenditure on health)
property.definition: Share of total current expenditure on health funded by external (rest of the world) institutional units providing revenues to financing schemes.
property.numerator: Total external (rest of the world) funding (12-month period).
property.disaggregation: Disease, main type of care, main type of provider, socioeconomic status, subnational level
property.measurement_method: This indicator traces the financing flows from external sources that provide the funds to public and private financing schemes. It includes resources in cash and in kind provided as loans and grants. Health accounts track records of transactions without double counting in order to reach a comprehensive coverage. Resources are accounted for in the same period as when they are used by financing schemes.

property.numerator: Sum of all capital expenditure on health (HK) - (12-month period).
property.denominator: Current + capital expenditure on health (12 month).
property.disaggregation: Disease, financing source institutional unit, financing agent, provider

name: Headcount ratio of catastrophic health expenditure

property.abbreviated_name: Headcount ratio of catastrophic health expenditure
property.definition: Proportion of the population (or sub-population) facing catastrophic health expenditures.
property.numerator: Total number of households with catastrophic health expenditure.
property.disaggregation: Subnational variables available in survey data
property.measurement_method: Financial protection indicators are based on information collected from population-based household expenditure surveys implemented by or in close collaboration with national statistical bureaus. Datasets from these surveys are typically obtained through technical contacts in-country but may also be available publically or for direct purchase. The two most common surveys are Household Budget Surveys and Living Standards Measurement Surveys.Such surveys include questions that elicit information on a household’s total consumption expenditure (i.e. monetary and in-kind payments on all goods and services, plus the monetary value of the consumption of home-made products). The main components of the consumption aggregate include expenses on food, non-food (clothing, household articles etc.), utilities (gas, telephone, electricity, etc.), education, health, and housing. Survey data allows for construction of the three key variables (i.e. total expenditure, food expenditure and out-of-pocket health expenditure) needed for the calculation of the headcount ratio of catastrophic health expenditure.
property.estimation_method: Headcount ratios are the estimated total number of households facing catastrophic health expenditures over the total number of households. A household is identified as facing catastrophic health expenditures when its out-of-pocket health expenditures represent 40% or more of its capacity-to-pay. Capacity-to-pay is estimated as total expenditure net of a subsistence level of food expenditure. The latter is calculated as the average food expenditure per equivalent adults of households in the 45th?55th food budget share distribution. When actual food spending falls below this amount, capacity-to-pay is defined as total expenditures net of actual food spending.
property.measurement_frequency: Every 1-5 years depending on implementation of population-based household expenditure surveys led by national statistics offices
property.preferred_data_sources: Population-based household expenditure surveys
property.other_data_sources: Health surveys with a module collecting expenditure data

note: Analyzing health equity using household survey data. Washington, DC: World Bank Group; 2008 (http://www.worldbank.org/en/topic/health/publication/analyzing-health-equity-using-household-survey-data, accessed 06 May 2015).

Ke Xu, David B Evans, Kei Kawabata, Riadh Zeramdini, Jan Klavus, Christopher J L Murray. Household catastrophic health expenditure: a multicountry analysis. Lancet. 2003;362:111?7 (http://www.who.int/entity/health_financing/documents/lancet-catastrophic_expenditure.pdf, accessed 06 May 2015)

Ke Xu. Distribution of health payments and catastrophic expenditures: methodology (discussion paper EIP/HSF/DP.05.2). Geneva: World Health Organization; 2005 (http://www.who.int/entity/health_financing/documents/dp_e_05_2-distribution_of_health_payments.pdf, accessed 06 May 2015).

name: Headcount ratio of impoverishing health expenditure

property.abbreviated_name: Headcount ratio of impoverishing health expenditure
property.definition: Proportion of the population (or sub-population) facing impoverishing health expenditures.
property.numerator: Total number of households with impoverishing health expenditure.
property.disaggregation: Subnational variables available in survey data
property.measurement_method: Financial protection indicators are based on information collected from population-based household expenditure surveys implemented by or in close collaboration with national statistical bureaus. Datasets from these surveys are typically obtained through technical contacts in-country but may also be available publically or for direct purchase. The two most common surveys are Household Budget Surveys and Living Standards Measurement Surveys.Such surveys include questions that elicit information on a household’s total consumption expenditure (i.e. monetary and in-kind payments on all goods and services, plus the monetary value of the consumption of home-made products). The main components of the consumption aggregate include expenses on food, non-food (clothing, household articles etc.), utilities (gas, telephone, electricity, etc.), education, health, and housing. Survey data allows for construction of the three key variables (i.e. total expenditure, food expenditure and out-of-pocket health expenditure) needed for the calculation of the headcount ratio of impoverishing health expenditure.
property.estimation_method: Headcount ratios are the estimated total number of households facing impoverishing health expenditures over the total number of households. A household is identified as facing impoverishing health expenditures when its out-of-pocket health expenditures push it below a poverty line (i.e. a household is above the poverty line when taking its total expenditure gross of out-of-pocket payments but below the poverty line when taking total expenditure net of out-of-pocket payments). The poverty line is defined as subsistence level food expenditure estimated as the average food expenditure per equivalent adults of households in the 45th?55th food budget share distribution. When actual food spending falls below this amount, then capacity-to-pay is defined as total expenditures net of actual food spending.
property.measurement_frequency: Every 1-5 years depending on implementation of population-based household expenditure surveys led by national statistics offices
property.preferred_data_sources: Population-based household expenditure surveys
property.other_data_sources: Health surveys with a module collecting expenditure data

note: Analyzing health equity using household survey data. Washington, DC: World Bank Group; 2008 (http://www.worldbank.org/en/topic/health/publication/analyzing-health-equity-using-household-survey-data, accessed 06 May 2015).

Ke Xu. Distribution of health payments and catastrophic expenditures: methodology (discussion paper EIP/HSF/DP.05.2). Geneva: World Health Organization; 2005 (http://www.who.int/entity/health_financing/documents/dp_e_05_2-distribution_of_health_payments.pdf, accessed 06 May 2015).

name: International Health Regulations (IHR) core capacity index

property.abbreviated_name: International Health Regulations (IHR) core capacity index
property.definition: Percentage of attributes of 13 core capacities that have been attained at a specific point in time. The 13 core capacities are: (1) National legislation, policy and financing; (2) Coordination and National Focal Point communications; (3) Surveillance; (4) Response; (5) Preparedness; (6) Risk communication; (7) Human resources; (8) Laboratory; (9) Points of entry; (10) Zoonotic events; (11) Food safety; (12) Chemical events; (13) Radionuclear emergencies.
property.numerator: Number of attributes attained.
property.measurement_method: Based on a set of attributes of 13 core capacities from a standard WHO instrument.
property.estimation_method: Biannual
property.preferred_data_sources: IHR core capacity monitoring framework: checklist and indicators for monitoring progress in the development of IHR core capacities in States Parties. Geneva: World Health Organization; 2013 (http://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/10665/84933/1/WHO_HSE_GCR_2013.2_eng.pdf, accessed 29 March 2015).
property.other_data_sources: World Health Assembly governing body documentation: official records. Geneva: World Health Organization (http://apps.who.int/gb/or/, accessed 29 March 2015).

name: Life expectancy at age 60 years

property.definition: The average number of years that a person of 60 years of age could expect to live if exposed to the sex- and age-specific death rates prevailing at the time of his/her 60th birthday
property.numerator: Sex
property.denominator: Derived from life table with age-sex specific mortality rates
property.disaggregation: Impact

name: Healthy life expectancy at birth

property.definition: The average number of years that a person can expect to live in full health by taking into account years lived in less than full health due to disease and/or injury
property.numerator: Sex

name: Distribution of causes of death in health facilities

property.abbreviated_name: Distribution of causes of death in health facilities
property.definition: Percentage distribution of main causes of death in health facilities, expressed as a percentage of total deaths in health facilities
property.numerator: Age (under 5, 5+ years), vaccine-preventable diseases

name: Leading outpatient diagnosis

property.definition: Rate per 1000 population and percentage distribution of the main diagnostic categories
property.numerator: Age (under 5, 5+ years), sex

name: Leading inpatient admissions by diagnosis

property.definition: Number, rate per 1000 population and percentage distribution of the main diagnostic categories
property.numerator: Age (under 5, 5+ years), sex

name: Prevalence rate of neglected tropical diseases

property.abbreviated_name: Prevalence rate of neglected tropical diseases
property.subdomain: Reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent health
property.definition: Number of prevalent cases of neglected tropical diseases per 100 000 population
property.numerator: Age group, disease, sex

name: Prevalence of severe mental disorders

property.definition: Number of cases of severe mental disorders per 100 000 population
property.numerator: Age, sex, type of disorder

name: Prevalence of visual impairment

property.definition: Number of persons living with severe visual impairment per 100 000 population
property.numerator: By cause, age, sex

name: Children aged under 5 years who are underweight

property.abbreviated_name: Children aged under 5 years who are underweight
property.definition: Percentage of children aged under 5 years whose weight-for-age is below -2 standard deviations of the WHO Child Growth Standards median
property.numerator: Place of residence, sex, socioeconomic status

name: Percentage of women of reproductive age who are underweight

property.abbreviated_name: Percentage of women of reproductive age who are underweight
property.definition: Percentage of women aged 15-49 years with low BMI (< 18.5 kg/m2)
property.numerator: Place of residence, socioeconomic status

name: Minimum acceptable diet

property.definition: Percentage of children aged 6-23 months of age who receive a minimum acceptable diet
property.numerator: Outcome

name: Urinary iodine concentration in children aged 6-12 years

property.abbreviated_name: Urinary iodine concentration in children aged 6-12 years
property.definition: Median urinary iodine concentration (?g/L) in children aged 6-12 years
property.numerator: Place of residence, sex, socioeconomic status

name: Households that have iodized salt

property.definition: Percentage of households that have iodized salt (> 15 ppm)
property.numerator: Place of residence, socioeconomic statusAlso: compute by children aged < 5 years living in households with iodized salt

name: Prevalence of heavy episodic drinking

property.definition: Percentage of adults (15+ years) who have had at least 60 grams or more of pure alcohol on at least one occasion weekly (approximately equivalent to standard alcoholic drinks)
property.numerator: Place of residence, sex, socioeconomic status Also: adolescents (5 or more standard drinks)

name: Abstainers

property.definition: Percentage of adults (15+ years) in a given population who have not consumed any alcohol during their lifetime
property.numerator: Age, place of residence, sex, socioeconomic status Also: not in last 12 months

name: Low consumption of fruit and vegetables among adults

property.abbreviated_name: Low consumption of fruit and vegetables among adults
property.definition: Percentage of adults (aged 18+ years) who eat less than five servings of fruit and/or vegetables (400 grams) on average per day (age-standardized)
property.numerator: Place of residence, sex, socioeconomic status

name: Total energy intake from saturated fatty acids

property.abbreviated_name: Total energy intake from saturated fatty acids
property.definition: Age-standardized mean percentage of total energy intake from saturated fatty acids in persons aged 18+ years
property.numerator: Place of residence, sex, socioeconomic status

name: Raised cholesterol among adults

property.definition: Age-standardized prevalence of raised total cholesterol among persons aged 18+ years (defined as total cholesterol ? 5.0 mmol/L or 190 mg/dL), and mean total cholesterol
property.numerator: Place of residence, sex, socioeconomic status

name: Safe injecting practices among injecting drug users

property.abbreviated_name: Safe injecting practices among injecting drug users
property.definition: Needles/syringes distributed per person who injects drugs per year
property.numerator: Age (<25/25+ years), sex

name: Multiple sexual partnerships

property.definition: Percentage of women and men aged 15-49 years who have had sexual intercourse with more than one partner in the last 12 months

name: Discriminatory attitudes towards people living with HIV

property.abbreviated_name: Discriminatory attitudes towards people living with HIV
property.definition: Percentage of women and men aged 15-49 years who report discriminatory attitudes towards people living with HIV in two standard survey questions (respond “No” or “It depends” to any of two questions)
property.numerator: Age, HIV status, sex

name: Prevalence of female genital mutilation

property.subdomain: Reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent health
property.definition: Percentage of women aged 15-49 years who have undergone female genital mutilation/cutting
property.numerator: Age, place of residence, socioeconomic status

name: Non-partner sexual violence prevalence

property.definition: Percentage of women aged 20-29 years who have ever experienced sexual violence by a non-partner from age 15 years
property.numerator: Age

name: Seat-belt wearing rate

property.definition: Percentage of car occupants (i.e. drivers and passengers) who use seat-belts
property.numerator: Outcome

name: Helmet wearing rate

property.definition: Percentage of motor occupants (i.e. drivers and passengers) who use helmets
property.numerator: Outcome

name: Population with basic hand-washing facilities with soap and water at home

property.abbreviated_name: Population with basic hand-washing facilities with soap and water at home
property.definition: Percentage of population with soap and water at a hand-washing facility commonly used by family members.
property.numerator: Place of residence (urban, rural), socioeconomic status Also: proportion of schools providing basic drinking-water, sanitation and hygiene

name: Timing of first antenatal visit

property.subdomain: Reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent health
property.terms: Reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent
property.definition: Percentage of pregnant women aged 15-49 years who had their first antenatal visit in the first trimester (before 16 weeks)
property.numerator: Age, place of residence, socioeconomic status,  type of provider

name: Zinc for treatment of diarrhoea

property.subdomain: Reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent health
property.terms: Reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent
property.definition: Percentage of children aged 0-59 months with diarrhoea receiving zinc supplementation
property.numerator: Outcome

name: HIV-testing in key populations

property.definition: Number of people tested HIV positive linked to care in the last 12 months (disaggregated by key population)
property.numerator: Key population

name: Pregnant women counselled and tested for HIV

property.abbreviated_name: Pregnant women counselled and tested for HIV
property.definition: Percentage of women who were counselled during antenatal care for their most recent pregnancy, accepted an offer of testing and received their test results, among all women who were pregnant at any time in the two years preceding the survey
property.numerator: Outcome

name: Prevention of mother-to-child transmission during breastfeeding

property.abbreviated_name: Prevention of mother-to-child transmission during breastfeeding
property.definition: Percentage of HIV-exposed breastfed infants whose mothers are receiving antiretroviral therapy at 3 months (and 12 months)
property.numerator: Outcome

name: Early infant testing coverage

property.definition: Percentage of HIV-exposed infants born within the last 12 months who received an HIV test within 2 months of birth
property.numerator: Test result

name: Cotrimoxazole prophylaxis among HIV-positives who are eligible

property.abbreviated_name: Cotrimoxazole prophylaxis among HIV-positives who are eligible
property.definition: Percentage of eligible HIV-positive individuals who receive cotrimoxazole (CTX) prophylaxis according to national guidelines
property.numerator: Outcome

name: Needles/syringes distribution

property.definition: Needles/syringes distributed per person who injects drugs
property.numerator: Outcome

name: Coverage of prevention programmes among key populations

property.abbreviated_name: Coverage of prevention programmes among key populations
property.definition: Percentage of sex workers/men who have sex with men/people who inject drugs exposed to HIV prevention programmes (respond “Yes” to two specific exposure questions in surveys)
property.numerator: Age, sex

name: Male circumcision

property.definition: Percentage of men aged 15-49 years who are circumcised
property.numerator: Age, place of residence, sex, sociocultural variables, socioeconomic variables

name: TB status assessment among HIV-positive people

property.abbreviated_name: TB status assessment among HIV-positive people
property.definition: Percentage of adults and children enrolled in HIV care who had their TB status assessed and recorded during their last visit
property.numerator: Outcome

name: Confirmed cases of MDR-TB

property.definition: Number of confirmed cases of MDR-TB detected during a specified time period
property.numerator: Patterns of drug resistance, treatment history

name: Household ownership of insecticide treated net (ITN)

property.abbreviated_name: Household ownership of insecticide treated net (ITN)
property.definition: Percentage of households with at least one ITN
property.numerator: Place of residence, socioeconomic status

name: Treatment-seeking behaviour for children with fever

property.abbreviated_name: Treatment-seeking behaviour for children with fever
property.definition: Percentage of children under 5 years of age with fever in the previous two weeks for whom advice or treatment was sought
property.numerator: Place of care-seeking (public, private)

name: Access to insecticide treated net (ITN) in the household

property.abbreviated_name: Access to insecticide treated net (ITN) in the household
property.definition: Percentage of population at risk with access to an ITN in the household.
property.numerator: Each ITN is assumed to be used by two people

name: Appropriate treatment among children treated for malaria

property.abbreviated_name: Appropriate treatment among children treated for malaria
property.definition: Percentage receiving first-line antimalarial treatment among those children under 5 years of age with fever in the last two weeks who received any antimalarial
property.numerator: Outcome

name: Annual blood examination rate

property.definition: Annual blood examination rate
property.numerator: Outcome

name: Malaria diagnostic testing rate

property.definition: Percentage of suspected malaria cases that had a diagnostic test
property.numerator: Outcome

name: Malaria test positivity rate

property.definition: Percentage of confirmed malaria cases (by microscopy or rapid diagnostic test) among all tested cases
property.numerator: Outcome

name: Coverage of case management for selected neglected tropical diseases

property.abbreviated_name: Coverage of case management for selected neglected tropical diseases
property.definition: Proportion of the population requiring case management that received treatment and care
property.numerator: Age group, diease, sex.

name: Coverage of preventive chemotherapy for trachoma

property.abbreviated_name: Coverage of preventive chemotherapy for trachoma
property.definition: Proportion of the population living in endemic areas requiring preventive chemotherapy for trachoma that received treatment
property.numerator: Age group, sex

name: Coverage of preventive chemotherapy for foodborne trematode infections

property.abbreviated_name: Coverage of preventive chemotherapy for foodborne trematode infections
property.definition: Proportion of the population living in endemic areas requiring preventive chemotherapy for foodborne trematode infections that received treatment
property.numerator: Age group, sex.

name: Drug therapy and counselling to prevent heart attacks and stroke

property.abbreviated_name: Drug therapy and counselling to prevent heart attacks and stroke
property.definition: Percentage of eligible persons (defined as aged 40 years and older with a 10-year cardiovascular disease risk ? 30%, including those with existing cardiovascular disease) receiving drug therapy and counselling (including glycaemic control) to prevent heart attacks and strokes
property.numerator: Age, sex

name: Cataract surgical rate and coverage

property.definition: Percentage of people who received cataract surgery among those in need in a specified time period
property.numerator: Age, sex

name: Use of assistive devices among people with disabilities

property.abbreviated_name: Use of assistive devices among people with disabilities
property.definition: Percentage of people with disabilities who have and use appropriate assistive devices
property.numerator: Outcome

name: Cause-specific case fatality rates for major causes

property.abbreviated_name: Cause-specific case fatality rates for major causes
property.definition: Cause-specific deaths per 100 admissions for major causes and overall in health facilities
property.numerator: Age (under 5, 5+ years), overall and cause-specific, facility-specific

name: Antenatal care: blood pressure measured

property.subdomain: Reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent health
property.definition: Percentage of women who had blood pressure measured at the last antenatal visit
property.numerator: Age, place of residence, socioeconomic status, type of facility

name: Antenatal care: tested for syphilis

property.subdomain: Reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent health
property.definition: Percentage of women attending antenatal care services who were tested for syphilis
property.numerator: Age, place of residence, socioeconomic status, type of facility

name: Antenatal care: treated for syphilis

property.subdomain: Reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent health
property.definition: Percentage of women attending antenatal care services who tested positive for syphilis and received treatment
property.numerator: Age, first/any visit, place of residence, socioeconomic status Also: add whose sexual contacts were traced

name: Antenatal corticosteroid use

property.subdomain: Reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent health
property.definition: Percentage of newborns with confirmed ultrasound gestational age of less than 34 weeks whose mothers received antenatal corticosteroids
property.numerator: Outcome

name: Prevention of postpartum haemorrhage in health facilities

property.abbreviated_name: Prevention of postpartum haemorrhage in health facilities
property.subdomain: Reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent health
property.definition: Percentage of women receiving oxytocin immediately after the birth of the baby (within 1 minute of delivery), before the birth of the placenta, irrespective of mode of delivery
property.numerator: Output

name: Severe systemic infection/sepsis in the postnatal period

property.abbreviated_name: Severe systemic infection/sepsis in the postnatal period
property.subdomain: Reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent health
property.definition: Percentage of women in health facilities with severe systemic infection/sepsis in the postnatal period, including readmissions (after birth in a facility)
property.numerator: Outcome

name: Newborns receiving essential newborn care

property.subdomain: Reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent health
property.definition: Percentage of newborns who received all four elements of essential newborn care: immediate and thorough drying, immediate skin-to-skin contact, delayed cord clamping, and initiation of breastfeeding in the first hour
property.numerator: Output

name: Neonatal sepsis

property.subdomain: Reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent health
property.definition: Newborns with suspected severe bacterial infection who receive appropriate antibiotic therapy (infant reportedly stopped feeding well and/or stopped moving on its own)
property.numerator: Outcome

name: Feeding of children born to HIV-positive mothers

property.abbreviated_name: Feeding of children born to HIV-positive mothers
property.definition: Percentage of children born to HIV-positive women who are feeding in line with national guidelines on HIV and infant feeding
property.numerator: Outcome

name: Pneumonia treatment (children)

property.subdomain: Reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent health
property.definition: Percentage of children who are correctly prescribed an antibiotic for pneumonia
property.numerator: Outcome

name: Male partner testing for HIV among women attending antenatal care

property.abbreviated_name: Male partner testing for HIV among women attending antenatal care
property.definition: Percentage of pregnant women attending antenatal care whose male partner was tested for HIV in the last 12 months
property.numerator: Outcome

name: Knowledge of HIV transmission among young women and men

property.abbreviated_name: Knowledge of HIV transmission among young women and men
property.definition: Percentage of young women and men (15-24 years) who correctly identify ways of preventing the sexual transmission of HIV and who reject major misconceptions about HIV transmission
property.numerator: Age (15-19, 20-24 years), place of residence, sex, socioeconomic status

name: Cancer survival rates

property.definition: Percentage of persons with cancer who survive at least 5 years after diagnosis, after correction for background mortality in a given time period (cohort)
property.numerator: By cancer site

name: 30-day hospital case fatality rate - acute myocardial infarction (stroke)

property.abbreviated_name: 30-day hospital case fatality rate - acute myocardial infarction (stroke)
property.definition: Percentage of hospital inpatients with primary diagnosis of acute myocardial infarction (stroke) who died within 30 days after admission
property.numerator: Impact

name: Postoperative sepsis

property.definition: Postoperative sepsis as a percentage of all surgeries
property.numerator: Age, sex

name: Postoperative pulmonary embolism/thrombosis rate

property.definition: Percentage of cases of postoperative pulmonary embolus or deep vein thrombosis among all major surgeries
property.numerator: Outcome

name: Hospitals with systems for adverse event reporting and learning for patient safety

property.abbreviated_name: Hospitals with systems for adverse event reporting and learning for patient safety
property.definition: Percentage of hospitals with systems for adverse event reporting and learning for patient safety
property.numerator: Output

name: Hospital readmission rates

property.definition: Percentage of unplanned and unexpected hospital readmissions for tracer conditions (acute myocardial infarction, pneumonia, asthma, diabetes)
property.numerator: Output

name: Waiting time to elective surgery

property.definition: Average inpatient waiting time for elective (i.e. non-urgent) surgeries - cataract, coronary angioplasty, hip replacement, knee replacement)
property.numerator: Output

name: Patient satisfaction

property.definition: Percentage of survey respondents who report to be satisfied or very satisfied with the health services
property.numerator: Age, place of residence, sex, socioeconomic status

name: Neonatal death reviews

property.definition: Percentage of neonatal deaths occurring in the facility that were audited
property.numerator: Also: perinatal death reviews

name: General service readiness

property.definition: Percentage of health facilities that have a basic set of equipment and amenities present on the day of the visit
property.numerator: Facility type, managing authority Also: average number of items per facility

name: Hospital admission rates

property.definition: Number of hospital admissions per person per year
property.numerator: Age, sex

name: Bed occupancy rate

property.definition: Percentage of available beds that have been occupied over a given period
property.numerator: Also: average length of stay (for selected interventions)

name: Surgery rate

property.definition: Number of surgeries by type (minor/major, specifics) per 1000 population
property.numerator: Age, place of residence, sex, socioeconomic status

name: Caesarean section rate

property.definition: Percentage of deliveries by caesarean section
property.numerator: Age, place of residence, socioeconomic status

name: Medical devices/essential technologies

property.definition: Density of medical equipment per million population
property.numerator: By type (magnetic resonance imaging, computed tomography [CT] scanners)

name: Access to palliative care

property.definition: Consumption of morphine-equivalent strong opioid analgesics (excluding methadone) per death from cancer in a given time period
property.numerator: Output

name: Opioid agonist pharmacotherapy used for the treatment of opioid dependence (maintenance)

property.abbreviated_name: Opioid agonist pharmacotherapy used for the treatment of opioid dependence (maintenance)
property.definition: Availability of opioid agonist pharmacotherapy (such as with methadone, buprenorphine or buprenorphine/naloxone) for maintenance treatment of opioid dependence.
property.numerator: Output

name: Turnover rate

property.definition: Percentage of health workers leaving public sector employment (dentists, midwifery personnel, nursing personnel, pharmacists, physicians, physician associates) in the last year
property.numerator: By cadre Also: age (< 30, 30-49, 50+ years), location, (urban/rural), place of employment, sex

name: National human resources for health self-sufficiency

property.abbreviated_name: National human resources for health self-sufficiency
property.definition: Percentage of foreign-trained, non-national health workers (dentists, midwifery personnel, nursing personnel, pharmacists, physician generalists, physician specialists, physician associates)
property.numerator: By cadre Also: age (< 30, 30-49, 50+ years), location, (urban/rural), place of employment, sex, sector (public/private/other)

name: Policy index

property.definition: Existence of a up-to-date national health strategy and national health plans linked to health needs and priorities
property.numerator: Input
